title.value: 30x30 biodiversity gains rely on national coordination
title.justification: Title is clearly indicated at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Title: 30x30 biodiversity gains rely on national coordination

extractions.description: The paper evaluates how different scenarios for expanding protected areas to 30% of land by 2030 would capture the climatically viable ranges of Canadian terrestrial vertebrates, plants, and butterflies. It emphasizes the importance of national coordination to maximize biodiversity protection and minimize trade-offs among various conservation priorities.

type.justification: The paper involves data collection, species distribution modeling, and the evaluation of different conservation scenarios to derive empirical findings.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on strategies for biodiversity conservation through protected areas and spatial prioritization of land.
The paper addresses the impact of future climate conditions on biodiversity and the importance of considering climatic viability in conservation planning.
name.quote: It is increasingly important to directly consider future climates in spatial planning...

name.justification: The study includes spatial prioritization as a key method to identify lands that maximize biodiversity protection.
Zonation 5 was explicitly mentioned as used for spatial prioritization.

is_contributed.justification: The paper did not introduce Zonation 5 as a new model but used it as an existing tool for analysis.

is_executed.justification: The Zonation software was applied to execute the spatial prioritization scenarios in the study.

is_compared.justification: Multiple conservation scenarios were built and compared using Zonation 5.

referenced_paper_title.value: Novel methods for spatial prioritization with applications in conservation, land use planning and ecological impact avoidance.
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the title of the referenced paper where Zonation 5 is detailed.

name.value: Database of Vascular Plants of Canada (VASCAN)
name.justification: The paper references this specific dataset to gather plant species distribution data.
name.quote: Database of vascular plants of Canada (VASCAN).

referenced_paper_title.value: Database of vascular plants of Canada (VASCAN).
referenced_paper_title.justification: The title is pulled directly from the references mentioned in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: ...are available in the following repository: https://figshare.com/... Database of vascular plants of Canada (VASCAN).

name.justification: The study involves computational analysis typically conducted using R, particularly for modeling and data analysis.

referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the title of the referenced paper where the species distribution modeling techniques in R are detailed.
